Author: Yun Jung Choi
Title: GitHub Copilot for Azure (Preview) Launches in Visual Studio 2022 with Azure MCP Support
EnhancedContent:
The GitHub Copilot for Azure extension is now in Public Preview for Visual Studio 2022 (17.14+). It brings a curated set of Azure developer tools‚Äîexposed through the Azure MCP server‚Äîdirectly into GitHub Copilot Agent Mode in Visual Studio. The extension automatically installs and manages the Azure MCP server, so you can query resources, diagnose issues, deploy with azd, and run Azure CLI commands‚Äîall from the Copilot Chat.

[Try GitHub Copilot for Azure](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=github-copilot-azure.GitHubCopilotForAzure2022&ssr=false#overview)

*Ship Azure features without leaving Visual Studio. Agent-powered, MCP-enabled, no extra setup.*

## **What‚Äôs in the Public Preview?**

- **Zero-setup Azure MCP server**
The extension automatically downloads and starts the Azure MCP server the first time you open Copilot Chat‚Äîno manual install required. (You‚Äôll see it in the tools list in Agent Mode.) *(Note: the MCP server version included with the extension may occasionally trail the latest upstream release by a few versions.)*
- **Agent Mode + Azure tools**
Let Copilot pick the right tools for your goal‚Äîor choose specific tools from the toolbox in the Copilot Chat window. Typical tasks include: list and inspect resources, diagnose issues, pull app logs, deploy with azd, run Azure CLI commands, and more.

## **Get started**

### **Prerequisites**

- Visual Studio 2022 17.14 or later (Agent Mode + MCP support)
- An active GitHub Copilot subscription and Copilot Chat enabled in Visual Studio
- A Microsoft account with access to an Azure subscription (or start free below)

### **Install & set up**

1. 1. Install the **[GitHub Copilot for Azure (Preview)](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=github-copilot-azure.GitHubCopilotForAzure2022)** extension for Visual Studio 2022.
*The extension starts the Azure MCP server automatically‚Äîno manual setup required.*
2. Open **Copilot Chat** and select **Agent Mode**.

[!\[AgentMode image\](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAASwAAABJAQMAAAC9/YlrAAAAA1BMVEXW1taWrGEgAAAACXBIWXMAAA7EAAAOxAGVKw4bAAAAGUlEQVRIie3BMQEAAADCoPVP7WMMoAAAgBsLHwAB4m67cgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2025/08/AgentMode.png)
3. Click **Select tools** and check to enable the **Azure Extension**.

[!\[SelectTools image\](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAASwAAABJAQMAAAC9/YlrAAAAA1BMVEXW1taWrGEgAAAACXBIWXMAAA7EAAAOxAGVKw4bAAAAGUlEQVRIie3BMQEAAADCoPVP7WMMoAAAgBsLHwAB4m67cgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2025/08/SelectTools.png)

[!\[AzureExtensionChecked image\](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAASwAAAB0AQMAAAAFGZ0YAAAAA1BMVEXW1taWrGEgAAAACXBIWXMAAA7EAAAOxAGVKw4bAAAAG0lEQVRYhe3BMQEAAADCoPVPbQ0PoAAAAAB4MRGsAAGq9ReRAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2025/08/AzureExtensionChecked.png)
4. In your prompts, include resource details for best results (subscription, resource group, resource name).
